work.name: HeKA team - Inserm-Inria-Université Paris Cité
work.summary: PhD on the detection and prediction of chemotherapy responses from EHRs, under the supervision of Bastien Rance and Adrien Coulet. Clinical data warehouses hold important information about chemotherapies and their effects, but it’s often scattered and hard to interpret. To make use of this valuable data, I developed two knowledge graphs called OntoTox and ChemoOnto. These graphs helped me organize and analyze the information effectively. Using these frameworks, I compared standardized and actual chemotherapy regimens. Leveraging these comparisons, I am currently working on predicting chemotherapy responses.

work.name: Inserm - Paris Georges Pompidou hospital
work.summary: I took part in the QualiHealth project aimed at improving the quality of healthcare data. I developed text mining tools to extract information from medical narrative reports during COVID crisis. I helped in the realisaton of OntoDol, an ontology on chronic pains.

work.name: Inserm - Paris Georges Pompidou hospital
work.summary: High-Throughput Phenotyping on glomerular disease narrative reports.

work.name: Parasitology Unit of the Center Dr. Hideyo - Merida, Mexico
work.summary: Identification of blood meals from Triatomia dimidiata in the Yucatán.

work.name: EcoSys laboratory, INRA
work.summary: Characterization of metal contaminations in urban farm soils.
